result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:16 PM Defendant Charles Wayne Rose in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address updated. Cash bond set of $200.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim R.L.L. or R.A.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No possession of any weapons. Defendant to contact public defender's office for appointment of counsel. Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 9am by zoom.
